DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effect of Botox and casting to placebo and casting for reducing toe walking problems in children who are idiopathic toe walkers.
DOC.brief_title: Trial of a Botulinum A Toxin (Botox) Injection in the Gastrocnemius Muscle in Children With Idiopathic Toe Walking
DOC.detailed_description: Patients who have been seen by one of the 5 paediatric orthopaedic surgeons at British Columbia's Children's Hospital and have been referred to the Shriner's gait lab for assessment of idiopathic toe walking will be eligible for the study.
DOC.criteria: Patients who have been seen by one of the 5 paediatric orthopaedic surgeons at British Columbia's Children's Hospital and have been referred to the Shriner's gait lab for assessment of idiopathic toe walking Clinical toe walkers toe walkers as per gait lab's definition (loss of 1st ankle rocker, early heel rise [prior to 30% of the cycle] and A1 kinematic data) Aged 5 15 years old Parents and patients educated about protocol and willing to partake Cooperative patient with gait analysis and injection
